lead_paragraph: The protests came as rescue teams spent a third day searching for survivors in the rubble of a building that collapsed in a suburb of the capital, killing more than 300.

byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Manik reported from Dhaka, Jim Yardley from New Delhi, and Steven Greenhouse from New York.
byline.original: By JULFIKAR ALI MANIK, JIM YARDLEY and STEVEN GREENHOUSE

snippet: The protests came as rescue teams spent a third day searching for survivors in the rubble of a building that collapsed in a suburb of the capital, killing more than 300....
abstract: Thousands of garment workers rampage through industrial areas of Bangladeshi capital Dhaka, smashing vehicles and setting fire to at least two factories in violent protests ignited by deadly building collapse that killed at least 340 workers.

headline.main: Bangladeshis Burn Factories to Protest Unsafe Conditions
headline.seo: Violent Protests Follow Building Collapse in Bangladesh
headline.print_headline: Bangladeshis Burn Factories to Protest Conditions
